message_1: What happens when copper is placed in a solution of silver nitrate? Write the balanced chemical equation for the reaction and explain why this is a single replacement reaction.
message_2:
When copper is placed in a solution of silver nitrate, a single replacement reaction occurs. In this reaction, copper replaces silver in the silver nitrate compound, forming copper nitrate and solid silver. The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

Cu (s) + 2 AgNO3 (aq) â†’ Cu(NO3)2 (aq) + 2 Ag (s)

This is a single replacement reaction because one element (copper) is replacing another element (silver) in a compound (silver nitrate). The copper atom essentially "trades places" with the silver atom in the compound, resulting in the formation of copper nitrate and solid silver.
